ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Mixed hearing loss (Left ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Consistent with history of chronic otitis media, cholesteatoma, mastoidectomy, and ossiculoplasty, evidenced by air-bone gaps.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss (Right ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Mild high-frequency sensorineural hearing loss observed at 3000-8000 Hz.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Eustachian tube dysfunction (Right ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Indicated by negative middle ear pressure and hypercompliant tympanic membrane.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Monitor hearing sensitivity in context of long-standing history and surgeries.
Assess speech reception thresholds and word recognition abilities.
Evaluate middle ear status, particularly the mastoid cavity on the left and pressure on the right.
Standard battery test, though not measured at this appointment.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: The patient demonstrates stable, asymmetric hearing. The right ear has normal sensitivity sloping to a mild high-frequency sensorineural loss with negative middle ear pressure. The left ear shows a mixed hearing loss ranging from mild to moderately severe, consistent with the history of mastoidectomy and ossiculoplasty. Speech recognition is excellent bilaterally. Tympanometry reveals a large ear canal volume in the left ear, consistent with the surgical history.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Normal (250-2000 Hz) sloping to mild SNHL (3000-8000 Hz). Left ear: Moderately severe rising to mild mixed loss (250-2000 Hz), sloping to moderately severe mixed loss (3000-4000 Hz). Significant air-bone gaps.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT: Right 13 dB, Left 43 dB. WRS: Right 92%, Left 96%.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Hypercompliant with excessive negative pressure (-160 daPa). Left ear: Flat with large ear canal volume (2.7 mL).

tests.name: Acoustic reflexes
tests.result_summary: Threshold and decay testing were not measured.

proposed_items: Discuss amplification options (hearing aids) for the left ear
Return for hearing test after medical management and as needed
counseling_actions: Review test results confirming stable hearing with no significant changes
Explain that the flat tympanogram and large canal volume in the left ear are expected due to mastoid surgery
Advise continued follow-up with otologist as scheduled

escalation.rationale_short: Patient is already under care; continue scheduled follow-up for medical management.

follow_up_plan.timeline: As scheduled with otologist; Audiology follow-up after medical management or as needed
follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor hearing stability and manage amplification needs.

expected_outcome: Hearing remained stable with no significant changes in thresholds or WRS.
Patient will follow up with an otologist as scheduled.
Plan established to discuss amplification for the left ear and use of HAT technology.
